business.headline: Sensex, Nifty open higher as FIIs return to D-Street after India-US trade dealThe S&P BSE Sensex added 260.37 points to 84,326.12, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 77.30 points to 25,944.60 as of 10:15 am.

Delhi 5-star hotel rates cross Rs 10 lah per day and AI plays a roleAI was already under fire for threatening jobs and changing the way people work. Now, it seems to be hitting wallets in an unexpected way.

India eyes diverse energy import sources, to ensure stable and affordable supplyThe Foreign Secretary's statement came amid questions over India's purchases of Russian oil, following remarks by US President Donald Trump last week that India had "committed to stop directly or indirectly" importing Russian crude.

Aye Finance IPO opens: Should you subscribe? Check GMP and other detailsFounded in 1993, Aye Finance is an NBFC that provides secured and unsecured loans to micro and small businesses. Its products include working capital loans, mortgage-backed loans and property-based financing for businesses in manufacturing, trading and services.

Fractal Analytics IPO opens today: Check price band, GMP and key detailsThe latest grey market premium for Fractal Analytics IPO stands at Rs 17, suggesting an estimated listing price of around Rs 917 and a possible gain of about 1.9% per share.
Sensex ends 485 points higher, Nifty above 25,800; SBI jumps 8%The S&P BSE Sensex added 485.35 points to end at 84,065.75, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 173.50 points to close at 25,867.30.

Who settles insurance claims fastest in 2026? Check if your insurer is in top 10Many people buy insurance to make sure their family is financially safe if something unexpected happens. But buying a policy is only one part of the decision. The bigger question is whether the insurer will actually pay the claim on time.

Draft Income-tax Rules 2026 and new forms out: What changes for taxpayers?The drafts have been opened for public comments for 15 days, until February 22, 2026. The tax department has invited taxpayers, professionals and industry bodies to review the proposals and share feedback, saying the aim is to make the rule-making process more participative and practical.

India's GDP to grow 6.4% in FY27, fastest among G-20 nations: Moody'sThe global rating agency said steady economic growth will create a solid base for financial stability and support credit demand across sectors.

Gold rises Rs 3,000, silver up Rs 13,000: Will prices go up further?A sudden spike in gold and silver prices has put bullion back in the spotlight. The rally has shifted focus to the next big question: are prices set to rise even further?

Think the middle class got nothing in Budget 2026? Here are the hidden gainsMany middle-class taxpayers finished listening to Budget 2026 with a sense of disappointment. No big announcements, no instant tax relief. But look closer, and the Budget reveals a series of quieter reforms that could meaningfully ease everyday financial pressures.

Sensex jumps 500 points: 3 reasons why stock market is rising todayThe S&P BSE Sensex was trading 491.04 points higher at 84,071.44, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 168.40 points to trade at 25,862.10. The rise came after a mix of positive global cues, strong buying by foreign investors, and sharp gains in PSU banking stocks.

SBI share price jumps 7% to hit 52-week high. Here's why and if you should buySBI shares have been on a steady rise over the past year. The stock has gained 7.54% in the last five trading sessions and 13.04% over the past one month. Over six months, the shares are up 37.35%, while the one-year gain stands at 53.50%.

How Norway turned oil into a $2 trillion fund that may never run outNorway is more often known as one of the happiest countries in the world which has the best Northern Lights, not as a financial powerhouse. Yet behind this image of calm and comfort sits one of the most powerful financial institutions on the planet.
Sensex opens 400 points higher, Nifty above 25,800; SBI gains 6%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 377.94 points to 83,958.34, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 119.10 points to 25,812.80 as of 9:55 am.

How is the digital shift changing UAE real estate for investors?Investor decisions are now increasingly shaped upstream through digital discovery, data-led targeting, and algorithmic visibility well before a site visit or broker engagement occurs.

Are mutual funds really the best place to invest your money right now?Headlines on the India–US trade deal, India–EU FTA, Budget 2026, swings in gold and silver and a sudden sell-off in IT stocks have followed one another in quick succession, and when so much unfolds at once, many investors end up reacting to every market move.

India agreed to open agriculture, dairy sectors to US players? Piyush Goyal answersEarlier, Piyush Goyal shared the details of the deal that followed a framework interim trade agreement between the two countries, aimed at boosting exports, jobs and market access. The trade deal will formally be signed in March.

Reduced US tariffs of 18% on India come into effect. What it meansThe agreement will reduce US reciprocal duties on Indian exports to 18 per cent, while scrapping tariffs entirely on items such as generic medicines, gems and diamonds, and aircraft components—opening up stronger export prospects across several key sectors.

India-US trade deal to boost exports, safeguard farmers' interests: Piyush GoyalUnion Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said the India-US interim trade framework is a historic step toward achieving USD 500 billion in bilateral trade. He announced that reciprocal tariffs on Indian exports to the US will fall sharply from 50% to 18%.

entertainment.headline: This is not a theatre: Ajith snaps at unruly fans at Abu Dhabi racing track Actor Ajith Kumar lost his cool at the Abu Dhabi racing track due to unruly fans. He is participating in the Asian Le Mans Series endurance race.

Was Akshay Kumar's Bhooth Bangla originally Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2? T-Series clarifies T-Series has clarified that there is no connection between Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2 and Bhooth Bangla. The studio denied all rumours about script reuse and reaffirmed its ownership of the franchise, warning against unauthorised use.

BTS members face security concerns at airport; fans express outrage BTS members faced chaotic scenes and security challenges at Incheon Airport during their comeback preparations. The incident raises urgent questions about idol safety and the need for stricter fan management.
Why Kumud Mishra's performance in Vadh 2 feels so unsettling In Vadh 2, Kumud Mishra steps away from his usual soft-spoken roles to play a fierce and intimidating jail superintendent.

Zoya Akhtar working on Zindagi Na Milegi Dobara sequel, original trio back: Report Zoya Akhtar is planning to revive her Zindagi Na Milegi Dobara world with a sequel soon. A report has suggested that the original trio is likely to be back for the project.

Sonu Nigam pauses concert to reunite lost child with family, shares video online Singer Sonu Nigam assisted a lost boy named Sri Sai on stage in Hubbali, easing his nerves with music and jokes before the child was safely reunited with his uncle. The artiste posted a video on social media.

Gen-Z defends Baghban's Sanjay as green flag in viral reel, Samir Soni reacts A new viral Instagram reel is leading younger audiences to reconsider the character of Sanjay from the 2003 film Baghban. It questioned earlier narratives that depicted the children as neglectful and emotionally detached. Samir Soni also commented on the reel.

Arijit Singh's 1st post after quitting playback is a tribute to Anoushka Shankar Arijit Singh performed live in Kolkata alongside Anoushka Shankar for the first time since announcing his decision to step back from playback singing. In a social media note later, he expressed gratitude for the opportunity and shared his experience.

Jana Nayagan goes to revising committee: What's next for Vijay's farewell film? Vijay's Jana Nayagan has now been sent to the CBFC revising committee after complaints about its content. The film's release continues to face delays amid ongoing legal and administrative hurdles.

Nagarjuna confirms Sankranthi 2027 release for his next film Actor Nagarjuna Akkineni's next film is set for release during Sankranthi 2027, with speculation about a possible sequel to his previous hits and collaboration with his son Naga Chaitanya. The announcement was made by his production house.

Shahid Kapoor: Part Romeo, part Haider but always an imperfectly perfect hero Shahid Kapoor has built a career on characters that are difficult to admire and impossible to ignore. From Ishq Vishk and Kaminey to Haider, Kabir Singh and the upcoming O' Romeo, the actor has rejected the idea of the perfect Bollywood hero.

Cardi B-Stefon Diggs unfollow each other after Super Bowl, spark split rumours The relationship between rapper Cardi B and NFL player Stefon Diggs came under scrutiny after they unfollowed each other on social media following the Patriots' defeat in Super Bowl LX.

Catherine O'Hara's cause of death confirmed by health authorities The comedic actor and two-time Emmy winner Catherine O'Hara died at her Los Angeles home after a brief illness, with officials listing pulmonary embolism and rectal cancer as causes of death.

Bad Bunny wipes Instagram hours after explosive Super Bowl halftime show Bad Bunny's Instagram account was wiped clean hours after his high-profile Super Bowl performance, prompting speculation and debate among fans and critics as the artist remains silent.

Taapsee Pannu's ASSI to host six special premieres across Tier-2 cities Taapsee Pannu's ASSI to screen exclusively for cinema lovers in Patna, Ahmedabad, Lucknow, Indore, Delhi and Kolkata ahead of its big-screen release. The film is slated to hit the theatres on February 20.

They love to hate me: Mallika Prasad on impact of villain's role in Mardaani 3 In an exclusive interview with India Today, actor Mlallika Prasad spoke about her character in Mardaani 3 and how it changed her life. She even recalled sharing screen space with Rani Mukerji.

Upasana Konidela thanks doctors, fans in emotional post after welcoming twins In a heartfelt post on social media, Ram Charan's wife Upasana Konidela thanked the doctors, well-wishers and fans for their unwavering love, support and prayers during her delivery.

Watch: Aamir Khan slips during World Pickleball League 2026 semi-finals Aamir Khan participated in an exhibition match at the World Pickleball League 2026 semi-finals in Mumbai, where he played alongside three enthusiasts and experienced a brief slip on court.

Siddharth Anand keen to return to romance: I want to do it all Director Siddharth Anand, known for his recent action blockbusters, has revealed his intention to return to romantic films, stating that his creative choices are driven by compelling stories rather than size or genre.

general news.headline: Paper Tiger Pakistan's India boycott bluff that fooled no oneT20 World Cup 2026: What began as a bold stand in the name of solidarity quickly unravelled, as Pakistan's India boycott met financial reality, ICC pragmatism and a rivalry too valuable, too loud and too lucrative to quietly abandon.

US cuts Bangladesh tariffs to 19%, offers duty-free access to some garmentsBangladesh has secured a reduced 19 per cent tariff on exports to the US under a new trade agreement. The US, initially, had proposed tariffs of up to 37 per cent on Bangladeshi exports in April.

Elon Musk, Mark Zuckerberg seen at 'wild' dinner party with Epstein in new filesIn the newly released trove of Jeffrey Epstein files, Tesla CEO Elon Musk and Meta's Mark Zuckerberg are pictured as guests at a swanky dinner party, which the sex offender termed "wild".

Has Sarvam AI really beaten ChatGPT, Google Gemini? YES and NOSarvam AI has been at the centre of many discussions on social media in the past couple of days. The Indian AI company has outperformed ChatGPT and Google Gemini in some key areas. So, can we say Sarvam AI has beaten the best, including Google Gemini and ChatGPT? Yes and no.

Why UPSC's red line on repeat attempts is a tough reformFor years, the UPSC allowed already-selected officers to reappear in the Civil Service Examination. While they sought "better" services, seats for fresh aspirants shrunk. This drained public resources too. The UPSC, with the new rule, is trying to curb the practice. There are some inter-services power dynamics, too, at play in the story.

UK to get 1st Muslim PM? Shabana Mahmood in focus amid Starmer's Epstein scandalAs Keir Starmer struggles to steady his leadership after the Epstein files shook Downing Street, speculation has grown over who could succeed him as the UK Prime Minister. Among the names gaining traction is Home Secretary Shabana Mahmood.

Delhi 5-star hotel rates cross Rs 10 lah per day and AI plays a roleAI was already under fire for threatening jobs and changing the way people work. Now, it seems to be hitting wallets in an unexpected way.

Not satisfied: Bihar MLA Maithili Thakur questions Minister over state of hospitalIn the Bihar Assembly, singer-turned-MLA Maithili Thakur strongly criticised the government's false claims about the state of a hospital in her Alinagar constituency. She appealed for immediate healthcare improvements to benefit thousands.

Zoya Akhtar working on Zindagi Na Milegi Dobara sequel, original trio back: ReportZoya Akhtar is planning to revive her Zindagi Na Milegi Dobara world with a sequel soon. A report has suggested that the original trio is likely to be back for the project.

Tantric angle emerges in Delhi car deaths, victims met baba hours earlierDelhi Police are questioning the connection of a tantric and his associate in the case of the dead bodies found inside a parked car on the Peeragarhi flyover. The three victims met the baba and his aide in the morning, hours before their bodies were discovered.

Owaisi used as political scarecrow: Revanth Reddy slams BJP's 'divisive politicsTelangana CM A. Revanth Reddy said that the BJP projects Owaisi as a political "lifeline" and frequently raises his name while claiming to champion religious causes. He questioned why no action had been taken against Owaisi if the BJP truly considered him a threat, despite being in power at the Centre and in several states.

No copies of ex-Army chief's unapproved book published or sold: Penguin IndiaIn an official statement, Penguin Random House India said it holds the sole publishing rights to the memoir but has not released the book in print or digital form.

If you're watching this, I am dead: Iran man makes video appeal to Trump, kills selfAn Iranian man reportedly took his own life after posting a video urging US President Donald Trump and Western governments not to negotiate with Tehran. He claimed that the Khamenei regime was responsible for at least 40,000 deaths in Iran, and that any deal would be a betrayal of the protestors.

Karyna Shuliak, the mystery woman in Epstein's final call who became his heirNewly released documents shed light on Karyna Shuliak, a Belarusian dentist and Jeffrey Epstein's girlfriend. Files detail a relationship marked by loyalty and strain that lasted until Epstein's death in 2019, with Shuliak named his main beneficiary.

Sri Lanka President thanks Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif for India boycott U-turnT20 World Cup: Sri Lanka President Anura Kumara Dissanayake thanked Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif after Pakistan confirmed it will play India on February 15 in Colombo. The U-turn ended boycott uncertainty around the T20 World Cup's biggest fixture.

How did Rahul Gandhi get an unpublished book by Gen Naravane?An unpublished book has reached Parliament, and it was by none other than former Army chief General MM Naravane (Retd) who oversaw one of the biggest India-China clashes since 1962. Did the publisher go ahead with printing Gen Naravane's Four Stars of Destiny even before the Defence Ministry approved the manuscript? How did Rahul Gandhi get a copy of the "unpublished" book?

This is first Ferrari EV, it has an Apple connectionFerrari has unveiled the interiors of its first-ever EV, the Luce. The interior has been designed by LoveFrom, a design firm cofounded by former Apple designer Jony Ive.

Live: Women BJP MPs write to Speaker Om Birla seeking action over House disruptionsParliament Session Live Updates: Women MPs from the BJP have written to Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla seeking the "strictest possible action, under the rules," against Opposition MPs over the February 4, 2026, ruckus in the House. The letter accuses Opposition members of entering the well, climbing the Speaker's table and disrupting proceedings. Meanwhile, the Parliamentary Committee on External Affairs will meet today, the same day the India bloc is set to hold a meeting at 10 am. Stay with IndiaToday.in for latest and live updates.

Canadian woman alleges harassment at Bengaluru hotel; management calls it extortionAccording to the complaint, the Canadian national stated that the accused massage therapist opened the door while she was changing, leaving her exposed and caught off guard.

Raising kids in a screen-first world: Do household chores still matter?In trying to ease their children's lives, many parents fall into snowplough parenting, removing challenges instead of building resilience. Experts say household chores help restore that balance.

Day jobs and World Cup dreams: Inside the relentless grind of associate nationsT20 World Cup: The Netherlands' World Cup journey is built as much on day jobs and distant dreams as it is on runs and wickets. At the Arun Jaitley Stadium, Zak leon-cash-ay's spell in the nets captures that quiet hope perfectly.

Himanta is desperate, revealed kids' passports, called for genocide: Gaurav GogoiCongress MP Gaurav Gogoi alleged that Himanta Biswa Sarma's actions reflect a desperate attempt to intimidate communities, claiming the Chief Minister "would go to any length," even engaging in illegal acts such as calling for genocide.

Jana Nayagan goes to revising committee: What's next for Vijay's farewell film?Vijay's Jana Nayagan has now been sent to the CBFC revising committee after complaints about its content. The film's release continues to face delays amid ongoing legal and administrative hurdles.

Israel will strike Iran alone if missile 'red line' is crossed, officials tell USIsrael has warned the US it may take unilateral military action if Iran crosses its missile threat threshold. Security sources said Israeli plans to dismantle Iran's missile production and launch infrastructure were conveyed in recent weeks through high-level diplomatic and military exchanges.

sports.headline: Boycott drama over: Pakistan now battle past demons vs USA T20 World Cup: Pakistan's boycott drama over India is finally behind them. Now Salman Ali Agha's side face old demons against the USA, knowing another slip could leave their Super 8 hopes hanging on results elsewhere.

NED vs NAM, T20 World Cup 2026: Live Score and Updates from New Delhi NED (Netherlands) vs NAM (Namibia) Live Score, T20 World Cup: After coming close to pulling off a famous win against Pakistan, Netherlands will be aiming to bounce back and get themselves on the board against Namibia as both sides face off in New Delhi.

Day jobs and World Cup dreams: Inside the relentless grind of associate nations T20 World Cup: The Netherlands' World Cup journey is built as much on day jobs and distant dreams as it is on runs and wickets. At the Arun Jaitley Stadium, Zak leon-cash-ay's spell in the nets captures that quiet hope perfectly.

Paper Tiger Pakistan's India boycott bluff that fooled no one T20 World Cup 2026: What began as a bold stand in the name of solidarity quickly unravelled, as Pakistan's India boycott met financial reality, ICC pragmatism and a rivalry too valuable, too loud and too lucrative to quietly abandon.

Sachin Tendulkar honours India's U19 captain Ayush Mhatre with special gift India captain Ayush Mhatre received a special gift from Sachin Tendulkar after the U19 World Cup title win upon his return to Mumbai. Mhatre led India to their sixth U19 World Cup triumph.

Sri Lanka President thanks Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif for India boycott U-turn T20 World Cup: Sri Lanka President Anura Kumara Dissanayake thanked Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif after Pakistan confirmed it will play India on February 15 in Colombo. The U-turn ended boycott uncertainty around the T20 World Cup's biggest fixture.

Matchday Preview: New Zealand, Pakistan look to strengthen Super 8 chances T20 World Cup 2026, Matchday preview: Day 4 of the Men's T20 World Cup features a high-stakes triple-header, with Namibia vs Netherlands, Netherlands vs UAE, and a marquee Pakistan vs USA clash across New Delhi and Chennai.

Lungi Ngidi, Aiden Markram star as South Africa take down Canada for clinical start T20 World Cup, SA vs CAN: South Africa made a spectacular start to their campaign, defeating Canada by 57 runs at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad. Aiden Markram scored a brilliant fifty, while Lungi Ngidi starred with a four-wicket haul to seal the win.

Pakistan's U-turn on India boycott, to play T20 World Cup clash as scheduled T20 World Cup 2026: The much-anticipated India-Pakistan clash will go ahead on February 15 in Colombo, the Pakistan government confirmed. Citing "outcomes achieved" and requests from friendly countries, Pakistan has cleared its team to take the field.

T20 World Cup: Pakistan nears U-turn on India boycott, final word on Tuesday T20 World Cup 2026: The much-anticipated India–Pakistan clash is set to go ahead as per the original schedule on February 15 in Colombo, with official confirmation expected within the next 24 hours.

Bangladesh's absence from T20 World Cup regrettable, no sanctions on BCB: ICC The International Cricket Council (ICC) said Bangladesh's absence from the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026 was unfortunate, but confirmed that the Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) will not face any financial, sporting or administrative punishment.

Bangladesh writes to PCB, urges Pakistan not to boycott India match in ColomboT20 World Cup, IND vs PAK: The Bangladesh Cricket Board has requested Pakistan to play their T20 World Cup match against India scheduled for February 15 in Colombo. Earlier, the Pakistan government had announced that the team would boycott the match.

Not many like Shubman Gill: Man United great applauds India star's humilityFormer England footballer Rio Ferdinand met India's Test and ODI captain Shubman Gill in Paris on Monday and later shared his admiration for the young cricketer on Instagram.

Pakistan on facing USA in grudge match: Learn from the past, don't dwell on itT20 World Cup 2026: Pakistan fast bowler Salman Mirza said the team is looking forward to facing the USA, who stunned them in the opening match of last year's tournament. Mirza also addressed the uncertainty surrounding the India–Pakistan clash scheduled for February 15

Jemimah rewarded with promotion in BCCI contracts after heroic World Cup showJemimah Rodrigues has earned a promotion to Grade B in the BCCI central contract following her heroic showing at the Women's World Cup, highlighted by a brilliant century against Australia in the semi-final.

Uncertainty over India match, but Pakistan prepare as usual in ColomboT20 World Cup 2026: Pakistan fast bowler Salman Mirza said the team is fully focused on their upcoming match against the USA on Tuesday. When asked about the scheduled India–Pakistan clash on February 15, Mirza reiterated that Pakistan's participation remains subject to government approval.

Virat and Rohit demoted, Shubman Gill promoted in BCCI annual contractsThe Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) on Monday announced the Annual Player Contracts for Team India Senior Men and Senior Women for the 2025–26 season, which runs from October 1, 2025 to September 30, 2026.

United States draw confidence from 2024 heroics to challenge Pakistan againT20 World Cup, PAK vs USA: Leg-spinner Mohammad Mohsin said the United States have a stronger squad than they did in 2024 and will head into their match against Pakistan on Tuesday in Colombo with confidence.

What Vaibhav did is bullying: Sunil Gavaskar's reply to Nasser's 'ICC' jibeFormer India captain Sunil Gavaskar has delivered a pointed response to English pundit Nasser Hussain, dismissing suggestions of Indian "bullying" in the ongoing Pakistan boycott controversy and instead drawing attention to what he termed "real bullying", the kind displayed with a bat in hand.

ICC T20 World Cup: Namibia and Netherlands call for a level playing fieldNamibia and the Netherlands face off in the ICC T20 World Cup on Tuesday, February 10. Ahead of the contest, players from both Associate nations called for more bilateral fixtures and greater exposure against Full Member teams in the build-up to global tournaments.

SA vs CAN, highlights: South Africa beat Canada by 57 runsSA (South Africa) vs CAN (Canada) Live Score, T20 World Cup: South Africa began their T20 World Cup campaign with a convincing 57-run win over Canada in their group clash at Narendra Modi Stadium on Monday.

Pakistan seek bilateral series vs India for boycott U-turn, ICC says noT20 World Cup 2026: The International Cricket Council rejected three of the five demands put forward by the Pakistan Cricket Board in return for reversing its decision to boycott the February 15 match against India. Pakistan's demands included the resumption of bilateral series against India and a tri-series involving Bangladesh.

Dominant Zimbabwe crush Oman to mark statement T20 World Cup comebackT20 World Cup, OMA vs ZIM: Zimbabwe marked their return to the T20 World Cup with a convincing eight-wicket win over Oman. Zimbabwe bowled their opponents out for 103 and then chased down the target with 39 balls to spare.

India vs Pak controversy Highlights: Pakistan to play vs India, confirms Pak governmentIndia vs Pakistan T20 World Cup controversy Highlights: The Pakistan government announced on Monday that the team will play their T20 World Cup match against India on February 15 in Colombo. Earlier, Pakistan had threatened to boycott the clash but reversed their decision following a meeting with the ICC and BCB on Sunday.

All England keeps Super 1000 status, India Open in Delhi despite hygiene rowThe Badminton World Federation announced the calendar for the 2027–30 cycle on Monday, February 9, with the All England Open retaining its top-tier status despite speculation over a possible downgrade. Meanwhile, Delhi is set to continue hosting the India Open Super 750 event, despite controversy earlier this year surrounding hygiene standards and pollution levels in the capital.

Rushing to Lahore: Midnight text from Bangladesh cricket chief amid T20 politicsAt 1 am on Saturday, the Bangladesh Cricket Board chief took a flight to rush to Lahore without even his BCB colleagues unaware of the plans. BCB chief Aminul Islam Bulbul reached Pakistan to be at the meeting between the ICC and the Pakistan Cricket Board. Here we analyse why Bulbul took the midnight flight to Lahore.

KL Rahul hundred knocks Mumbai out, powers Karnataka to semifinalKarnataka secured a semifinal berth in the Ranji Trophy by successfully chasing down a target of 325 against Mumbai, ending the defending champions' campaign and reviving hopes for their first title since 2015. KL Rahul was the star of Karnataka's win as he hit a hundred in the fourth innings in Mumbai.

Jammu and Kashmir reach semis for 1st time after Nabi's 12-wicket haulSixty-seven years after their first appearance in the Ranji Trophy, Jammu and Kashmir made history by reaching the semi-finals for the first time with a stirring 56-run victory over Madhya Pradesh in Indore.

T20 World Cup: Clinical Scotland and injury scare ruin Italy's dream debutItaly's historic first T20 World Cup outing turned into a tough lesson as Scotland handed them a 73-run defeat at Eden Gardens. Wayne Madsen's shoulder injury and Michael Leask's brilliance spoilt the Gli Azzuri debut.

Babar Azam putting pressure on Pakistan, not himself: Legends left confusedRicky Ponting and Ravi Shastri have raised concerns over Babar Azam's slow starts in Pakistan's T20 World Cup campaign. They believe Pakistan must act quickly, either shifting his role or making changes.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
